properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing heavy rain and large hail. Strong wind gusts are also possible. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-11T08:44:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-11T03:14:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2238134154.2019
Area: Cariboo - south including Williams Lake

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke plumes from several fires in Northwestern Ontario are moving over Western and Southern Quebec. The air quality could deteriorate if the smoke spread at ground level. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-07-11T10:59:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-11T01:26:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0317730726.2019

properties.Title: Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots and frequent lightning are expected or occurring in the area. Thunderstorms currently forming over Michigan will continue to move northeastward and cross the North Channel, Manitoulin Island and northern parts of Lake Huron and Georgian Bay tonight. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2019-07-11T07:49:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-11T04:52:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1320785783.2019
Area: Northern Lake Huron, Northern Georgian Bay

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 1:37 a.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This line of severe thunderstorms is located from 10 kilometres northeast of Milnet to 15 kilometres south of Bruce Peninsula National Park, moving northeast at 85 km/h. Locations impacted include: Sudbury, Bruce Peninsula National Park, Nickel Centre, Wanapitei Provincial Park, Chiniguchi Waterway Provincial Park, Sturgeon River Provincial Park, Beaverstone Bay, Capreol, Burwash, McVitties, Wanup, Porlock, Estaire and Paget. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-11T08:05:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-11T05:38:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0591457662.2019
Area: Bruce Peninsula - Sauble Beach - Tobermory, Greater Sudbury and vicinity, New Liskeard - Temagami, Espanola - Killarney, Manitoulin Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 12:30 a.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This line of severe thunderstorms is located from 15 kilometres west of Spanish River Provincial Park to 15 kilometres northwest of Espanola to 20 kilometres east of Gore Bay, moving northeast at 80 km/h. Locations impacted include: Espanola, La Cloche Provincial Park, Spanish River Provincial Park, Cartier, Lee Valley, Webbwood, Birch Island, Pogamasing, McKerrow, Anderson Lake, Whitefish Falls, Benny and Nairn Centre. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-11T07:24:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-11T04:31:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0415410291.2019
Area: Greater Sudbury and vicinity, Elliot Lake - Ranger Lake, Blind River - Thessalon, Espanola - Killarney, Manitoulin Island

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain. Severe thunderstorms with hail as large as golf balls and strong winds exceeding 100 km/h are possible this evening. These severe thunderstorms are likely to persist into the later evening hours. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-11T09:14:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-11T02:47:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1183657420.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail. Thunderstorms are expected to develop late this afternoon or this evening in west-central Saskatchewan. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe with hail to the size of loonies and wind gusts to 100 km/h. Thunderstorms will weaken later this evening. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-11T06:48:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-11T03:09:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1223141504.2019
Area: R.M. of Meadow Lake including Waterhen Res., R.M. of Beaver River including Pierceland and Goodsoil, Green Lake, R.M. of Loon Lake including Loon Lake and Makwa, R.M. of Big River including Big River and Chitek Lake
